tests.teacher_request: I need a 3-week project for my 5th grade class where students will track weather patterns and analyze climate data. They should use instruments to collect data and create a report. The project should cover multiple standards related to Earth's systems and engineering.
tests.original_utterance: I need a 3-week project for my 5th grade class where students will track weather patterns and analyze climate data. They should use instruments to collect data and create a report. The project should cover multiple standards related to Earth's systems and engineering.

standards.description: Develop a model using an example to describe ways the geosphere, biosphere, hydrosphere, and/or atmosphere interact.

learning_objectives.objective: Explain how the atmosphere, hydrosphere, and geosphere interact to influence weather patterns and climate in the Weather and Climate project.
Create a model that demonstrates the interactions between the Earth's systems that drive weather and climate in the Weather and Climate project.

formative_assessments.description: Discuss how the Earth's systems interact to influence weather patterns
Draw a model showing the interactions between the atmosphere, hydrosphere, and geosphere

summative_assessments.description: Construct a model that accurately depicts the interactions between Earth's systems that drive weather and climate patterns

scaffolds: Provide sentence starters for explaining system interactions
Give examples of models that show Earth system connections

standards.description: Obtain and combine information about ways individual communities use science ideas to protect the Earth's resources and environment.

learning_objectives.objective: Research how communities use scientific data about weather and climate to protect the environment in the Weather and Climate project.
Develop a plan to present findings on how the local community can use weather and climate data to protect resources in the Weather and Climate project.

formative_assessments.description: Find examples of how communities use weather and climate data to protect resources
Outline a plan to share findings on using weather/climate data for resource protection

summative_assessments.description: Present findings on how the local community can use weather and climate data to protect resources

scaffolds: Provide guiding questions for the research process
Review presentation best practices before final delivery

standards.description: Describe and graph the amounts of salt water and fresh water in various reservoirs to provide evidence about the distribution of water on Earth.

learning_objectives.objective: Collect and graph data on the distribution of water in different reservoirs as part of the weather station and data analysis report.
Explain how the distribution of water on Earth affects weather patterns in the Weather and Climate project.

formative_assessments.description: Measure and record amounts of salt and fresh water in different reservoirs
Create graphs to visualize the distribution of water on Earth

summative_assessments.description: Summarize findings on the distribution of water and explain how it impacts weather patterns

scaffolds: Review graphing techniques before creating visuals

standards.description: Conduct an investigation to determine whether the mixing of two or more substances results in new substances.

learning_objectives.objective: Design and conduct experiments to investigate how mixing different substances affects their properties in the Weather and Climate project.
Analyze data from experiments to determine if new substances were formed through mixing in the Weather and Climate project.

formative_assessments.description: Describe experimental design and observations from mixing substances
Interpret results to determine if new substances were formed

summative_assessments.description: Present findings on how mixing substances affects their properties and whether new substances were formed

scaffolds: Review data analysis techniques before final presentation

prerequisites: Understanding of Earth's major systems (atmosphere, hydrosphere, geosphere)
Basic scientific investigation skills (observation, data collection, analysis)
implementation_sequence: 3. Collect and analyze water distribution data (5-ESS2-2)
4. Research community use of weather/climate data (5-ESS3-1)
5. Develop final weather station and data analysis report
context_specific_tips: Focus on connecting weather/climate data to environmental protection
Emphasize hands-on experimentation with mixing substances
Incorporate data visualization to understand water distribution

result.contextualization: Standards aligned specifically for Weather and Climate project creating Weather station and data analysis report

tests.teacher_request: Looking for a 1-week project for my 1st graders about community helpers. No specific standards needed, just want something age-appropriate and engaging that helps them learn about different jobs in our community.
tests.original_utterance: Looking for a 1-week project for my 1st graders about community helpers. No specific standards needed, just want something age-appropriate and engaging that helps them learn about different jobs in our community.

standards.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about grade 1 topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

learning_objectives.objective: Discuss community helpers and their roles with classmates

formative_assessments.description: Observe students discussing community helpers and their roles

summative_assessments.description: Students present their community helper to the class

standards.description: Write informative/explanatory texts in which they name a topic, supply some facts about the topic, and provide some sense of closure.

learning_objectives.objective: Write an informative paragraph about a community helper and their role

formative_assessments.description: Review students' draft paragraphs about their community helper

summative_assessments.description: Students present their final paragraph about their community helper

implementation_sequence: Discuss community helpers and their roles
context_specific_tips: Encourage students to interview family members who are community helpers
Provide sentence starters to support discussions
Display visuals of different community helpers

result.contextualization: Standards aligned specifically for Community Helpers project creating Community helper presentation
